item.title: Python's combinations and combinations with replacement
item.description: Python’s combinations and combinations with replacement A recent Stack Overflow question had me looking at how to find a list of four numbers each from -1 to 1 that sum up to 1. Problem statement Generate every combination of four numbers(a.k.a. quadruplets) from (-1, -0.99, -0.98, ..., 0.98, 0.99, 1) that sum up to 1. Repetitions of numbers are allowed. For example: [0, 1, 0.12, -0.12], [0, 0, 0.5, 0.
